intro: Colutea kopetdaghensis, commonly known as the Kopetdag bryony, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in the Kopetdag Mountains. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, and it is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
